response.overview: Jordan and Natasha once shared a gentle high school romance—built on slow afternoons, quiet conversations, and the pocket camera they used to capture every moment they spent together. But graduation pushed them onto separate paths. Jordan left to study abroad, while Natasha stayed in their hometown. On the day they parted, Jordan placed the camera in her hands with one request: do not open the gallery until four years have passed.  Four years later, Natasha finally turns on the camera. Hidden among the old photos is a handwritten message directing her to return to the exact place where the final picture was taken. With a mix of hope and hesitation, she follows the clue. There, in the familiar setting that holds their last memory, she sees a figure she instantly recognizes—Jordan, standing exactly where their story paused.  Their reunion becomes a quiet reminder that some connections don’t disappear with time—some simply wait for the right moment to return.
response.title: Remember Me
